title: 110_hr5600
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Court, Offender Supervision, Parole, and Public Defender Employees Equity Act of 2008" allows retirement credit for certain employees transferred from District of Columbia service to federal service. Any individual serving as an employee or Member on or after the enactment of the Act can include qualifying District of Columbia service in calculating creditable service for specific provisions of title 5, United States Code. This service is not considered when computing the amount of benefits from the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. Qualifying District of Columbia service includes service performed by nonjudicial employees of the District of Columbia courts or employees of entities transferred to the Pretrial Services, Parole, Adult Supervision, and Offender Supervision Trustee. This service can be used to calculate creditable service for specific provisions of title 5, United States Code. Service performed by employees of the District of Columbia courts or entities transferred to the Pretrial Services, Parole, Adult Supervision, and Offender Supervision Trustee can be used to calculate creditable service for specific provisions of title 5, United States Code. Service performed by individuals in the District of Columbia Department of Corrections prior to their coverage as Federal Government employees, and for which they did not receive credit under specific provisions of title 5, United States Code, can be considered for calculating creditable service. Service performed by an individual as an employee of the District of Columbia Department of Corrections before becoming a Federal Government employee, and without receiving credit under specific provisions of title 5, United States Code, can be considered for calculating creditable service. The Office of Personnel Management will accept certification from the District of Columbia government regarding an individual's qualifying service and its duration.
